title: On the Word to St. Silouan, Keep Thy Mind in Hell and Despair Not
content: The now famous saying, keep thy mind in Hell and despair not, is a word given by God to St. Silouan one night as he struggled intensely with demons. Six months after going to the Holy Mountain St. Silouan was blessed to experience a vision of Christ in glory, in which he experienced the full Christ, and the life of Christ. Eventually he felt this grace subsiding and so he dedicated himself to extreme ascetical struggles in hopes of attracting the grace of God again.
